dc:title: Day After Day - February 1937
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: A colorful account of a winter morning at the Easton farm--warm fires and cold bedrooms, making butter, the frolics of Bessie the three month old calf. Speaks of guest rooms, hospitality, starting a Catholic lending library, and reading about cooperatives.
